text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Clinton fails in effort to bring Arafat and Netanyahu closer together
- Labour Ministry demands its inspectors put a minimum of fines on companies
- Rajoy will take to court those Town Halls that raise workers' salaries
EL MUNDO
- Ibarra proposes breaking relations with PP if Aznar doesn't end Cascos appointment
- Palestine summit fails
DIARIO 16
- Social clamour for Bank of Spain to cut rates today
- Aznar hit by first boycott of public workers for cuts
ABC
- Price of Asturias meets with French president
CINCO DIAS
- Another trillion in hidden debt - state-owned companies, authorized to fall into debt of 1.03 trillion
- Brussels will ignore Spain's telecommunications policies
- Rato, Pujol and the Treasury push Rojo toward a cut
EXPANSION
- Rojo backs budget and will decide today on cutting rates
- Nowwegian Norsk Hydro faces Villar Mir for control of Sefanitro
- BBV and SG Warburg will coordinate the sale of 3.8 percent of Gas Natural
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Arenas will apply new labour reform in 1997 with or without union support
- Botin affirms that when he buys a bank he aspires to have the majority
- Airtel will reduce its rates before year-end because of lower fees to Telefonica
